questions.question: I …………………. he is not at home.
questions.description: The conjunction that can be omitted after say, think, suppose, hope and expect.

questions.question: I consider the plan ……………………..
questions.description: To be can be left out after consider, think, suppose and report.

questions.question: The boys suggested ……………………….. to the park.
questions.description: We cannot use a to-infinitive after suggest. Instead, we use an ing form or a that-clause.

questions.question: He ………………………… he had written the letter.
questions.description: That cannot be left out after admit.

questions.question: We ………………………. you would succeed.
questions.description: That can be left out after hope.

questions.question: We saw him …………………….. out.
questions.description: The infinitive is used without to after see.

questions.question: The teacher made the boy …………………….. his lesson.
questions.description: The infinitive is used without to after make.

questions.question: We heard them ……………………..
questions.description: The infinitive is used without to after hear.

questions.question: We saw him ……………………… the bridge.
questions.description: We cannot use a to-infinitive after see. Instead we use an ing form or a bare infinitive.

questions.question: She kept the fire ………………………..
questions.description: In this structure the ing form indicates a state of continuity.

questions.question: We found the house ………………………….
questions.description: The past participle is used with a passive meaning in this structure.
